questions.question_text: Complete the sentences about number systems. Use the items from the list. Some items will not be used and each item is used at most once. (Bases for binary/hex, 8-bit min/max, bits per hex digit, symbols A–F.)
Add the two 8-bit binary numbers using binary addition. Give the answer in binary and show all working: 10011011 + 00010011.
Tick (✓) one box: correct definition of overflow in binary addition.
State what is meant by the colour depth of an image.
Describe the relationship between the resolution of the image and the file size of the image.
The image is compressed using lossless compression. Explain why lossless was chosen instead of lossy for this file to be downloaded and printed as a poster.
Identify one lossless method of compressing an image and describe the method.
Explain how a file is broken down into packets and transmitted over a network.
Complete and annotate the diagram to show the difference between serial full-duplex transmission (between two computers) and parallel simplex transmission (between two computers).
Circle three registers that are found in the Von Neumann architecture.
State the purpose of the CPU in the computer.

Computer A: 2.1 GHz quad-core; Computer B: 2.5 GHz dual-core; Computer C: 5.2 GHz single-core. Identify which computer is most likely to execute more instructions simultaneously and justify your answer.
Explain why Computer C can execute more instructions per second than Computer B.
Define the term instruction set.
An ATM detects a person within 1 m and displays a welcome message. Identify an appropriate sensor for detecting a person.
Describe the role of the microprocessor in detecting the person.
Describe features of the ATM that identify it as an embedded system.
For users who are unable to see: identify one other input device and one other output device that can be built into the ATM.
A search engine uses AI to identify relevant web pages. One characteristic of AI is the ability to learn. Identify three other characteristics of AI.
Explain how machine learning is used by the search engine.
NIC/MAC: Describe the other purposes of the network interface card (besides providing a MAC address).
Identify three characteristics of a MAC address.
Tick (✓) one box to identify a valid IPv4 address.
Identify the device in a network that can automatically assign an IP address to a computer each time it connects.
Define the term World Wide Web.
A URL includes the protocol HTTPS. Explain how HTTPS makes the transmission of data secure.
Protocol is one part of a URL. Give the other two parts of a URL.
Machine code is one low-level language. Identify one other low-level language and the translator needed for it.
A high-level language can be translated using a compiler or an interpreter. Describe advantages of using an interpreter instead of a compiler during development.
IDEs provide translators. Identify three other common functions of an IDE.
Tick (✓) one box to show the smallest data storage unit.
State how many tebibytes (TiB) are equal to 2 pebibytes (PiB).
Give the name of the process that is used to reduce the size of a file.
One reason the size of a file may need reducing is so that it has a shorter transmission time. Give one other reason why the size of a file may need reducing.
The ticket system has an output device that creates a paper ticket. Identify an appropriate output device to produce the paper ticket.
Two ticket numbers are 14B and 97A. Convert the two ticket numbers from hexadecimal to binary.
Give two reasons why the ticket number is displayed as hexadecimal instead of binary.
Convert the two ticket numbers from hexadecimal to denary: 02C and 10B.
Convert the two denary numbers into hexadecimal: 109 and 415.
An image is converted to binary to be represented by a computer. Complete the table with the missing terms and definitions about representing an image.
The data is sent using serial full-duplex data transmission. Give two reasons why serial full-duplex is a suitable data transmission method for the data.
Give one improvement that would be made to the data transmission if parallel transmission is used instead of serial transmission.
A checksum is used to check the data for errors after transmission. Describe the process of the checksum error detection method.
Identify one other error detection method that could be used to check for errors in the data.
Packets are transmitted across the internet. Tick (✓) one box to show which item would not be included in a packet’s header.
The packets of data may need to be reordered when they arrive at the computer in the restaurant kitchen. Explain why the packets of data may need to be reordered.
Complete the paragraph about asymmetric encryption using terms from the list (algorithm, plain text, cipher text, meaningless, public, private, readable/unreadable, etc.).
Data can also be encrypted using symmetric encryption. Give one reason why a person would use asymmetric encryption instead of symmetric encryption.
Complete the table with the missing terms and definitions about processing data (CIR, ALU, instruction set, cache, accumulator).
Identify the component in the CPU that is responsible for decoding an instruction.
Explain how the clock speed can affect the performance of a CPU.
Identify one other example of primary storage (besides RAM).
Explain why RAM is an example of primary storage and not secondary storage.
Describe how virtual memory could be used in this process to stop the computer crashing when RAM becomes full.
Give two features of solid-state (flash memory) storage.
Give two examples of solid-state (flash memory) storage.
One characteristic of the robot is that it has a mechanical structure. Give one other characteristic of a robot.
The robot has firmware. State what is meant by firmware.
Interrupts are generated when the robot is operating in the factory. Give two examples of interrupts that may be generated when the robot is in operation.
Give two advantages to the workers in the factory of using robots to move the car parts.
The robots have the ability to automatically adapt their own processes. State the name of the ability described.
Each computer has an operating system. One function of the operating system is to manage memory. Describe the role of the operating system in managing memory.
Describe how the hacker would perform a brute-force attack.
Give three cyber security solutions that could be used to help prevent a brute-force attack from being successful.
State what is meant by a digital currency.
The digital currency uses a process that involves a digital ledger. The ledger has time-stamped transactions that cannot be altered. Give the name of this process.
A computer stores data temporarily in random access memory (RAM). (a) RAM is one example of primary storage. Give one other example of primary storage.
(b) Give one reason why data is only stored temporarily in the RAM.
(c) The denary numbers 19 and 230 are converted to binary numbers to be stored in the RAM. Convert the two denary numbers to binary numbers.
(d) The hexadecimal numbers 35 and 8AD are converted to binary numbers to be stored in the RAM. Convert the two hexadecimal numbers to binary numbers.

(e) The 8-bit binary numbers 01100101 and 01110000 are stored in RAM. The binary numbers are added together. Add the two binary numbers using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. You must show all your working.
(f) An overflow occurs when two other 8-bit binary numbers are added together. Explain why the overflow error occurs.

(g) The negative denary number −22 is stored in RAM. Negative denary numbers can be represented as binary using two’s complement. Give the two’s complement 8-bit binary integer that would be stored for the denary number −22. You must show all your working.

A student has an image file stored on their computer. (a) The image file was taken by a digital camera. Tick (✓) one box to show whether a digital camera is an example of an input, output, process or storage device.
(b)(i) The size of the image file is 3072 bytes. Give the size of the image file in kibibytes (KiB).
(b)(ii) State the number of nibbles in 1 byte.
(c)(i) The image file has a colour depth of 32 bits. State what is meant by a colour depth of 32 bits.
(c)(ii) The colour depth of the image file is changed to 64 bits. Explain what effect this change has on the image file.
(d) The student uses lossless compression to compress the image file. Explain how the image file is compressed using lossless compression.

A programmer writes a program to store and sort all the data for the books in her home library. (a) The programmer uses a high-level language to write the program. One reason for writing the program using a high-level language is that it is easier to read and write. Give two other reasons why the programmer chose to use a high-level language.

(b)(i) The programmer uses an integrated development environment (IDE) to write the program. One function of the IDE is to provide a translator. Complete the statements about translators using terms from the list (e.g., compiler translates the whole code at once before executing it; produces an error report that displays all errors; interpreter translates and executes line by line; stops execution when an error is found, etc.).
(b)(ii) Give two other functions commonly found in an IDE. State the role of each function.
(c)(i) The programmer wants to print a list of all her books on paper. Identify a suitable type of printer that she could use to print this list.

(c)(ii) The programmer needs to connect the printer to her computer. The printer is on the same desk as her computer. Give a suitable method of data transmission that could be used to connect the computer to the printer. Explain your choice.
(c)(iii) An even parity check is used to detect errors in the data after it has been transmitted to the printer. Describe how an even parity check detects an error.

An employee uses a computer that has a Von Neumann architecture to complete many different tasks. (a) The computer has a central processing unit (CPU). Complete the table of components in the CPU and their descriptions (control unit, ALU, cache, program counter, clock, buffer).
(b) The computer is an example of a general purpose computer and not an embedded system. Explain why the computer is not an embedded system.

A hospital has computers and technology that it uses when caring for its patients. (a) One computer is an expert system that is used to help diagnose a patient’s illness. The doctor inputs the patient’s symptoms into an interface and a diagnosis is output. Describe how the expert system decides the diagnosis.

(b)(i) The hospital has a robot that is used to perform surgery. A doctor controls the robot from a different location to perform surgery on a patient. One feature of the robot is that it has electrical components. Give two examples of the electrical components of a robot.
(b)(ii) Explain the advantages of using the robot to perform surgery.
(b)(iii) Explain one disadvantage of using the robot to perform surgery.

(c)(i) Patients use a web page to log into their account to pay for treatment. The patient enters the uniform resource locator (URL) for the web page into their browser and the web page is requested and displayed. Complete and annotate the diagram to show how the web page is requested for the patient.

(c)(ii) A patient is making a payment through a secure connection. The secure connection is created using the secure socket layer (SSL) protocol. Explain how a secure connection is created using the SSL protocol.

A student records himself singing a song for his music project. The recorded sound is converted to binary to be processed by a computer. (a) Give one input device the student can use to record the song.
(b) The student uses sound editing software to edit the recorded sound. Tick (✓) one box to show whether sound editing software is an example of application, security, system or utility software.
(c)(i) Two binary numbers stored from the recording are 00011001 and 10110100. Convert the two binary numbers to denary numbers.
(c)(ii) Convert the two binary numbers to hexadecimal numbers.
(c)(iii) A logical right shift of two places is performed on the binary number 10100100. Give the binary number that would be stored after the logical shift has taken place.
(d) The two’s complement 8-bit binary integer 11001001 is also stored. Convert the two’s complement 8-bit binary integer to denary. Show all of your working.

(e) The table contains terms and descriptions about the process of converting analogue sound to binary. Complete the table with the missing term and descriptions. (Terms include sample rate and sample resolution.)

A company employee is editing a video for the company’s website. Data is stored in the random access memory (RAM) when the video is edited. The RAM becomes full and pages of data are transmitted to a partitioned section of the secondary storage to stop the computer from crashing. (a) Give the name of the partitioned section of the secondary storage that is used in this process.

(b) The secondary storage is a hard disk drive (HDD). An HDD is an example of magnetic storage. One feature of magnetic storage is that it uses platters. Give three other features of magnetic storage.
(c) Give the reasons why an HDD is an example of secondary storage.

A computer with a Von Neumann architecture has several hardware components. (a) Complete the table with the missing terms and descriptions about computer hardware. (Includes MAC address, register, clock, control unit (CU), and the processing unit within the CPU that can fetch, decode and execute instructions.)
(b) Identify three registers that are used in the fetch stage of the fetch–decode–execute (FDE) cycle.
(c) Circle the two buses that are used in the fetch stage of the FDE cycle. (Options include: binary, control, denary, data, information, hardware, software.)
A computer has an operating system. One function of the operating system is handling interrupts. (a) Describe the role of the operating system in handling interrupts.
(b) Give two other functions of an operating system.
(c)(i) Hardware and software interrupts are two types of interrupt. Give one example of a hardware interrupt.
(c)(ii) Give one example of a software interrupt.

An online company has a website that allows a user to buy products. The user types in the uniform resource locator (URL) for the website and this is sent to a domain name server (DNS). (a) Describe the role of the DNS.

(b) The website asks a user to input their username and password to log into their account. The company want to make their login system more secure. Tick (✓) one box to show one other security method that could be added to make the login system more secure. (Options: access levels, firewall, spyware, two-step verification.)

(c)(i) The company uses a proxy server to keep the web server safe from distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks. Complete and annotate a diagram to show how a DDoS attack is carried out on the web server.
(c)(ii) Identify two tasks that can be performed by a proxy server that are not performed by a firewall.

(d)(i) The company uses cookies to allow users to keep items in a shopping cart. The items remain in the cart after the user closes their web browser. Tick (✓) one box to show the type of cookie that is used for this process. (Options: dynamic, persistent, session, static.)
(d)(ii) Give three other ways that the company can use cookies.
(d)(iii) Cookies are stored by a web browser. Give two other functions of a web browser.
A weather station uses automated systems to collect and analyse data about the weather. The automated system uses sensors. (a) Give one other component that would be part of the automated system.
(b) One sensor that is part of the automated system is a temperature sensor. Give one other sensor that could be part of the automated system.
(c)(i) An alert is sent to an employee in the weather office if a temperature above 40 °C is detected. Explain how a temperature above 40 °C is detected for the alert.
(c)(ii) The data for the alert is sent using serial simplex data transmission. Explain how the data is sent using serial simplex data transmission.
(d) Give two advantages to the weather station employees of using an automated weather system.
(e) Give one disadvantage to the weather station employees of using an automated weather system.

(f)(i) The automated weather system is upgraded and given machine learning capabilities. Machine learning is part of a branch of computer science. Identify the name of this branch of computer science.
(f)(ii) Explain how the machine learning capabilities can be used to predict future weather.

Data is sent from an employee’s computer to a server. The data is correct when it is sent, but an error is detected when the data is received. (a) Describe how an error can occur in the data during transmission.

(b) Methods of error detection and correction can be added to make sure that errors are identified after data is transmitted. Complete the statements about methods of error detection and correction using terms from the list (e.g., parity even/odd, parity bit, echo check, ARQ, acknowledgement, timeout, positive/negative).
Tick (✓) one box to complete this sentence. A standard method of solution used to find a piece of data in an array is a ...
Four development life cycle stages and five descriptions are shown. Draw one line from each stage to the most appropriate description. Not all descriptions will be used.
A presence check is a type of validation check. State the purpose of a presence check.
A value input into a computer system must be an integer. Identify the validation check used to test whether the value input meets this requirement.
Write the pseudocode for an algorithm to input a number and check whether it is an integer. If it is an integer, accept it; otherwise output an error and re-input until valid.
A program only accepts data that contains more than 9 characters. Complete the table by inserting the missing test data, types, and purposes.
Given a pseudocode algorithm for inputting 1000 positive integers and computing highest, total, and average: identify five errors and suggest corrections (line-numbered).
Write the pseudocode statement to output the average of the numbers, rounded to two decimal places.
Explain how to change the corrected algorithm so that it also finds the smallest number and outputs its value at the end. Any code used must be fully explained.
Complete the trace table for the flowchart given the input: Y, 7, S, 9, Y, 5, M, 12, Y, 25, D, 5, N, 10, A, 6.
State the purpose of the algorithm.
Explain how to change the algorithm so that lower-case 'y' for Answer and lower-case operators work correctly.
Identify one more input-related error when the algorithm is run.

Write a program using arrays MemberID[] and Name[] to: provide a menu (new member/list/stop); validate menu input; input/validate a six-character unique membership code; store code and names in first available positions; list membership codes with first and last names; loop until stop.
Tick (✓) one box to complete this sentence. The pseudocode to store a hotel name held in the variable Name to a text file is ...
State the number of fields and records in the MajorCity table shown.
Identify the most suitable primary key field and give one reason.
Give the output from the SQL statement: SELECT City, Country, Population FROM MajorCity WHERE Continent = "South America" ORDER BY Population;
Complete the SQL to list only the code, city, country and continent of all capital cities in the table.
Draw a logic circuit for Z = (A NAND B) XOR (NOT (NOT B NAND C)). Each gate must have a maximum of two inputs. Do not simplify.
Complete the truth table from the given logic expression.
Tick (✓✓) one box to identify the type of test to only check for the largest or smallest acceptable value.

Four requirements for validating inputs and five types of validation check are given. Draw one line from each requirement to the most appropriate validation check. Not all validation checks will be used.
Identify and describe one verification check that could be applied when a new password is input into a system.

The following pseudocode algorithm uses a count-controlled loop to read in 10 names and store them in Names[]. Rewrite the algorithm in pseudocode, using a condition-controlled loop instead of a count-controlled loop.

A telephone number with 13 characters is input. The first character is '+', followed by a 2-digit country code (e.g., +20xxxxxxxxxx). The algorithm includes checks for 44 (UK) and 20 (Egypt). Write pseudocode to input the telephone number, extract the 2-digit country code, output the matching country, or output 'Unknown' if there is no matching country.
Explain how you could change the algorithm to repeatedly prompt for the telephone number until the number entered is 13 characters in length. Any code used must be fully explained.
Two library routines used in programming are MOD and DIV. State the purpose of each routine and give one example pseudocode statement for each.
An algorithm guesses game pseudocode is given. Identify the line numbers of the four errors and suggest a correction for each error.
Identify one method to make the algorithm maintainable. Give an example.
Consider the logic expression: X = (A AND B) XOR (B OR NOT C). Draw a logic circuit for this expression. Each logic gate must have a maximum of two inputs. Do not simplify the expression.
Complete the truth table for the given logic expression.
A bus company table BUS is provided. Identify one appropriate data type for the field Return.
State the reason for the data type chosen for Return.
Write the output from the SQL statement: SELECT RouteID, Destination, Time FROM BUS WHERE Driver = "A Patel";
Complete the SQL statement to display only the destination of the buses that have a return.
The variables A and B are used in a program. A holds a whole number and B holds text. Write pseudocode statements to declare the variables A and B.
The function Odds(X) returns 'Odd' if X is odd and 'Even' if X is even. Write pseudocode statements to define the function and call it using parameter A, storing the return value in variable B.
A flowchart represents an algorithm to calculate grades. Complete the trace table for the algorithm using the input data: 21, 46, 63, 91, 12.
Explain how the flowchart can be changed to produce the correct output.

1D array CompetitorName[] (25 competitors) and 2D array CompetitorScore[] (five events). Points[] stores totals. Write a program that: inputs valid scores (0–100) for each competitor/event; calculates highest points per event and outputs names of medal recipients; calculates highest total points for five events and outputs names of the competitors with the highest total.

Tick (✓) one box to complete the description of abstraction. Abstraction is part of the analysis stage of the development life cycle. Abstraction means A testing the solution to the problem. B writing a program using program code. C defining the sub-systems that make up the problem. D removing details from the problem that are not relevant.

A fence measuring 2 metres in height and 20 metres in length needs painting. The area of the fence needs to be calculated so that enough paint for the job is purchased. After the task is decomposed, there are three component parts: input, process and output. Three component parts and four example descriptions are shown. Draw one line from each component part to the most appropriate relevant description. Not all descriptions will be used.

A range check is used to validate that the input temperature is an integer between –100 and 0, inclusive. Suggest suitable normal, abnormal, extreme and boundary test data to test if this validation check is working correctly.
State one reason for using a verification check when inputting data.

Write the pseudocode for an algorithm to perform a double entry verification check, using the following criteria: • Input 10 numbers and store them in the array Numbers[] • Input the same 10 numbers again; as each number is input, compare it with its corresponding number in the array Numbers[] ◦ if the numbers match, move on to the next number ◦ if the numbers do not match, display both numbers and ask for the number to be re-entered ◦ store the re-entered number in the corresponding array location and move on to the next number. • When all the numbers have been checked, display a message to say the check has been completed. You do not need to declare any arrays or variables for this algorithm.

This pseudocode algorithm should allow 500 names of people and their heights to be entered and stored in two one-dimensional (1D) arrays ... (full algorithm shown). (a) Identify the line numbers of five errors in the pseudocode and suggest a correction for each error.
(b) Write the pseudocode statement that will output the average height rounded to one decimal place.

(c) Explain how you could change the corrected algorithm so that it will also: • find the height of the tallest person. • output the height of the tallest person at the end of the algorithm. Any program statements used must be fully explained.
Given an algorithm that processes words (full pseudocode shown). (a) Complete the trace table for the algorithm, using the input data: 2, RACECAR, TREAT.
(b) State the purpose of the algorithm on page 6.
(c) Explain how the algorithm knows when all the letters in the word have been checked so that it can stop checking.
The flowchart shows an algorithm that is used to input 50 numbers ... (range conditions given). (a) Complete the flowchart.

(b) Explain how you would alter the flowchart in 7(a) so that it will individually store each accepted value as it is entered and then output all the numbers, one after the other, outside of the loop that inputs values.
Draw the symbol for an XOR logic gate and complete the truth table for it.

A crane will only move if the operator is present and either the ignition key is present, or the operator code is correct. (i) Write the logic expression for the crane moving, where X = 1 represents movement.
(ii) Complete the truth table for the crane moving.

A database table, CapitalCity, stores data about capital cities. (a) Complete the table by writing one appropriate field from CapitalCity for each data type. Each field must be different. Data types: Boolean, integer, real, text.
(b) Complete the structured query language (SQL) statement to list only the name, country and population of all the cities in CapitalCity from the continent of Asia.

A program is required to allow students to calculate the volume of a number of standard three-dimensional shapes (cuboid, triangular prism, sphere). It must: output a validated menu; input required dimensions; create one function for each shape using the given formulae and parameters; output the volume in the main program, rounded to two decimal places; repeat until the stop option is chosen. Use pseudocode or program code with comments. Declare all variables and constants; all I/O must contain suitable messages.
Complete this flowchart for the biscuit weight check where biscuits between 16.2 g and 17.2 g inclusive increment PassCount, otherwise RejectCount, and stop when −1 is entered; then output totals.

Explain how to alter the flowchart in 1(a) so that it calculates and outputs the average weight of only the biscuits that passed the weight check. Any statements or symbols used must be fully explained.
Three uses of arithmetic operators and four results are shown. Draw one line from each use (355 DIV 10, 355 / 10, 355 MOD 10) to the correct result. Not all results will be used.
Bubble sort pseudocode (descending) contains errors. Identify the line numbers of four errors and suggest a correction for each error.
Complete PROCEDURE Swap with two parameters representing the indexes of the array elements to be swapped.
Write the pseudocode to transfer control to PROCEDURE Swap in the main loop.
Explain the difference between global variables and the variable declared inside PROCEDURE Swap.
An input must be an integer between 10 and 95 inclusive. State the type of validation check to test if the input meets this requirement.
Suggest suitable abnormal and extreme test data for the range 10–95 inclusive and give a reason for each choice.
A password must contain at least 12 characters. State the type of validation check.
Write pseudocode to input a new password and ensure it contains at least 12 characters, re-inputting with an appropriate error message until valid.

A store uses table COMPONENT for stock. Complete the table by giving appropriate data types (from: text, character, Boolean, integer, real, date/time) for the fields: ID, Name, Description, Price, NumberAvailable, MinimumLevel, ReOrdered, DateOrdered.
Complete the SQL to list only the unique identifier, component name and reorder date of all components that have been reordered.
Complete the trace table for the given algorithm using input data: COMPUTER. The algorithm stores consonants of the word into Store[] and then outputs them.
Describe the processes in the algorithm.
Draw the symbol for a NOR logic gate and complete its truth table.
Given inputs L (light/dark), M (motion), S (sound). Alarm A sounds if it is dark and if either motion or sound (or both) are detected. Write the logic expression for A.
Complete the truth table for the security system described in 7(b)(i).

Write a program for a video library using 2D arrays Video[] (title, format, year (string), storage code) and Results[]. Requirements: initialise arrays (Video up to 10 000, Results up to 20); menu (add/search/stop) with input validation; add stores data in first available location; search by title, copy matched rows to Results[], continue to end; output Results[] or suitable message if none; return to menu until stop. Use pseudocode or code with comments; all I/O with suitable messages; assume declarations done.
